item.title: Report E-2023090721
item.description:
Report E-2023090721

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 13, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was crushed during transit and released approximately 20-gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbent to the trailer floor and worked them in with hand tools, utilizing a degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. Crews patched the three (3) damaged drums and repalletized the remaining cargo for transport. All UN1263 impacted material was collected and containerized in three (3) 35-gallon and one (1) 95-gallon overpack drum and RLC personnel took possession of the waste to be added to the facility waste stream.

item.title: Report X-2023090759
item.description:
Report X-2023090759

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-02
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DRIVER PICKED UP 17 GREY PLASTIC BAGS. DRIVER NOTICED THAT THE BAGS FELT LIKE CANS AND GAVE THE PACKAGES TO THE AUDITOR WHO OPENED THE PACKAGES. ALL 17 BAGS HAVE 2 AEROSOL CANS OF "ZEVO FLING INSECT KILLER - FLY, GNAT, FRUIT FLY". THERE IS NOHAZMAT MARKS OR LABELS, NO INFORMATION ON THE THERMAL LABEL. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS ARE: 1ZAA97400335475818, 1ZAA97400331465345, 1ZAA97400337065445, 1ZAA97400330525399, 1ZAA97400338979000, 1ZAA97400334210980, 1ZAA97400334086937, 1ZAA97400335183768,1ZAA97400336215034, 1ZAA97400337863136, 1ZAA97400332662951, 1ZAA97400323444016, 1ZAA97400329399825, 1ZAA97400321903729, 1ZAA97400320015922, 1ZAA97400322662951, 1ZAA97400310996776.

item.title: Report X-2023090358
item.description:
Report X-2023090358

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Package was discovered wet and upon inspection, one of the press and twist caps were loose allowing liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened to stop further leaking

item.title: Report E-2023090557
item.description:
Report E-2023090557

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 12, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2735 was punctured while in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer floor and parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES deconstructed the pallet and removed one (1) 55-gallon drum from the pallet. The crew placed damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon overpack and the released material into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal. ES staged the material onsite to be processed via R+Ls normal waste stream.

item.title: Report X-2023090760
item.description:
Report X-2023090760

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: MIDDLEBURG HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS LEAKING ON SORT AISLE AND BROUGHT BACK TO DOOR 40. RESPONDER NOTICED BOX HAD A STRONG CHEMICAL ODOR AND SUSPECTED AN UNDECLEARED HAZMAT. RESPONDER CALLED SUPPORT CNETER AND TOOK PICTURES OF THE BOX. WAITED FOR FURTHER INSTRUCTIONS. PROCESSING THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023090293
item.description:
Report X-2023090293

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: VANDALIA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler received the box from a tugger and placed it on rollers. They noticed to bottom was damp and informed QA. QA staff used gloves and a hazmat barrel to remove the box from the van line. DescribePack: Outer package is slightly damp with no other damage. Can of MRC-f is dented in the corner and a small leak occurs only when pressure is applied to can. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Place in hazmat drum as soon as dampness of box was noticed.

DescribePack: carton was wet and torn due to four leaking plastic bottles inside that had loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ppe used to place carton in a hazmat bag and then inti a plastic tote.

The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFICATED PERSONNEL INFORMED OF DISTRESSED PACKAGE. SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW, NOTED LIQUID RELEASE CONTAINED TO PACKAGE. DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET AND UPON INSPECTION, THE CAP WAS LOOSE WHICH ALLOWED LEAKAGE TO HAPPEN DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: CAP WAS TIGHTENED TO MITIGATE FURTHER SPILLAGE

It appears to have been dropped on the side of the top which bent the lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a salvage drum to mitigate the effects of the release.

item.title: Report I-2023090081
item.description:
Report I-2023090081

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-23T00:30:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-18
  • City: Steubenville
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A specification cargo tank 1,000 gallons or greater containing any hazardous materials that (1) received structural damage to the lading retention system or damage that requires repair to a system int
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FIRST CLASS TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 9:40am, approximately 23 miles after having the trailer loaded at Langeloth, the fifth wheel failed and he trailer came seperated from the tractor. The driver was able to stay in front of the trailer and safely guide it to a stop in the left lane of US22 west of Steubenville, OH. The trailer was nose down on the ground but did not cause any leaks. Ohio State Highway Patrol was immediately called to the scene, and National Response Center was called to report a potential release. We were able to dispatch a nearby truck to the scene to transload the product onto another tank trailer as a tow truck lifted the front of the tank to level the product and get all the product off. We received a call from the driver at 12:21 pm to report that the roadway was being reopened.
